reviews.review_msg: Professor Nilsson is one of the best profs I've ever had! He is so happy to listen to what students have to say, and totally encourages discussion. Also, the way he lays out his course helps you avoid the end of term paper crunch. He is so knowledgeable about gender, and the books he chooses are AMAZING. I would take any course with him again!!

Dr. Nilsson is a GREAT guy. Endlessly helpful and always accessible, willing to meet with you on his own time outside office hours to help you with your paper or give you valuable feedback. The discussions in this course were extremely interesting and crucial to the content and assignments. Really cares about what he's doing.

A bit bumbling, would really have liked a bit more structure to his lectures; he relied pretty heavily on class discussion, which is hard in a group of 60+. Reasonably fair marker and very easygoing guy. If you come to class with a couple of killer comments and work hard on essays you'll do fine.
Solid prof. Readily available for extra help and is very supportive and encouraging with all students. Enthusastic about course content and runs a very engaging seminar and lecture.

Nilsson is a really laidback professor and makes a point of explaining his ideas clearly. If I had one piece of advice for his future students, it would be to make sure you research the history surrounding your essay topics! He's big into historical and social contexts.

This professor is one of the best in the department. Susan is kind, funny, approachable, and generates wonderful discussions that are relatable to the world around us, teaching us to think critically about the world in a fun way. She's so stylish as well! Beautiful inside and out :)
Amazing, stimulating, inspiring.

Susan is a really good prof, she cares about her students, and expects you to try your best. Her classes are extremely informative and interesting. You have to work for your mark. Then again, isn't that why we're in school?

She is a decent marker not too hard. She is a good proff you can tell she goes out of her way to make lectures informative and interesting. She is also easy to approach and talk to. Although a warning to those of you who don't usually talk in class she will pick on you.
Rough marker, expects the highest quality and will call you on last minute essay writing.  Very approachable and goes out of her way to make the class interesting. Fun person.

Her lectures are very well thought through.  She is also a great speaker.  However, your assignments/essays have to mirror her own though, otherwise you are in trouble (mark wise, of course).  If you feel lucky, take the course - you might be her sister/borther in-thought. And indeed, you will gain a lot from her lecures (no sarcasm at all).
She looks like she's 15!Classes were painful to sit through. Who really wants to sit through scores of student presentations and class discussions? Four hours...painful!
Responsible.  Helpful.  Friendly.  Knowledgeable.  Finicky with grammar (Hey, it's an English class), gives interesting ideas, and shows relations of texts to history, politics, cultures, and arts.

She confirmed for me that not all English professors are stuck up and above communicating with students.
 Her lectures were relevant, and she obviously cared about the learning process. Doesn't hesitate to tell students if they are on the wrong track and applauds you for having good input. Best prof I have had, wish she wasn't on mat. leave!!!

Nadine only seems to like her own ideas and usually thinks your idea is, to put it simply, stupid, or not as good as hers. Agreeing with the comment below, she is hard to approach and does seem to think she is superior than the rest, especially in tutorial discussions. I also had a difficult time understanding what she was trying to communicate.

Although Nadine is intelligent and knows the material, she has difficulty explaining herself clearly, and often comes across in a condescending way when you ask for clarification. Even though I did well in this course, I found her lack of approachability disappointing.

Nadine obviously knows her literature. The amount of time she spends on preparing lecture material AND providing useful comments on assignments must be applauded. Do your readings, answer questions insightfully, mind your grammar, and you will be well on your way. For everyone who laments the reading list: Learn to read a course syllabus!

Nadine is definitely not "hot", but interesting in a country-bumpkin sort of way.  Her lectures depend on class input, and she is fair with assignments and grading.  Even tho I received a good grade, she does play favorites and is very jealous of pretty girls in the class!Wo! She is passionate about her topics and tries to make a democratic class.
Nice, but she's inexperienced. She relies way too much on student participation. If you want to be taught something, look elsewhere.

Unless you enjoy frequent forays into Freudian/Lacanian analysis stay well clear.
 Although he clearly has a huge breadth of knowledge he is not very good at explaining concepts, nor at relating his obsession with Lacan to the coursework (and he will bring Lacan up no matter the course). Also, his way is the right way. Always.
 Engaging lecturer th

I have never been so displeased by a women's literature course.  We were told at the beginning that there would be no "-isms, -ologies, or -ianities" in our investigation of the texts, but then he smacked us with Darwinism's sexual selection theory and expected us not to defy him.  Most of this course was a thinly veiled attack on feminist thought.

I have had Dr. Ogden for two classes, and I find that while he is very passionate, he can be geninely approachable, even if he doesnt seem like it. He seems amazed that students are intimidated by him, but given his style, its not suprising. PickHisTopicsThat are out of left field (graphic novels)

Steven Ogden can improve by being organized and comprehending his students by listening carefully before jumping in to inaccurately paraphrase them and then make them spend the hour defending a point they never actually made. Also, assignment expectations and structure of deadlines are unclear. Strengths: creativity and technology proficiency.

Friendly??? Nor nice or helpful. Is unclear about assignments and rude when you ask for help. It was an interesting class and he is insightful but if you have a chance to take it with another prof then do so.
